summary: Palantir Technologies has been one of the best-performing stocks in the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 over the last year . The software developer has seen its stock soar by 361% over the past year . Investors should look closely at the company's valuation trends .  Palantir's market capitalization has risen from about $46 billion to more than $250 billion in just one year . As of this writing, the company's price-to-sales ratio (P/S) is about 91 . The company's P/S ratio reached a record high during the dot-com bubble .  Palantir's P/S is now more than double what some leading tech players have traded at during periods of pronounced stock market euphoria . Investors still need to consider what happened in the fallout from the dot-com boom and more recent trends in the AI arena to get a better understanding of where the stock may be headed .  Amazon is a much more valuable enterprise today than it was 26 years ago during the dot-com boom . While Cisco's valuation never fully recovered, the company's current market cap of $236 billion is still far greater than the mid-2000s . Nvidia's market cap is more than twice what it was just two years ago, when its P/S peaked at around 46 .  Palantir Technologies could eclipse its current market value of $250 billion eventually . However, there is also evidence suggesting that it will be trading at more reasonable prices for new buyers at some point . For investors who want to build a position in it now, I think the best strategy to use would be dollar-cost averaging . Through the first quarter, Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway held a stock portfolio worth $263 billion . Coca-Cola, Domino's Pizza and Amazon are three stocks from Berkshire's holdings that would make great additions to any investor's portfolio right now .  Coca-Cola is the largest beverage company in the world, with nearly $47 billion in trailing-12-month sales . Despite global economic upheaval over the past few years, it has managed to generate higher sales and robust profitability . It's a much-loved global brand, and everyone needs to drink .  Coca-Cola makes most of its concentrate in the U.S., shielding it from at least some of the impact of tariffs . The company has raised its dividend for the past 63 years straight . It provides safety and passive income for any kind of portfolio .  Domino's reported same-store sales growth of 3.7% in international markets, though U.S. comps were down slightly at 0.5% . The company has a long track record of growing comparable sales in a variety of economic conditions . With its franchise model and the global popularity of pizza, the company appears to have a long runway of growth .  Amazon's sales growth is slowing as it gets larger, but management is targeting greater efficiency . Berkshire Hathaway first bought a stake in the online retail giant in 2019 and still held 10 million shares at the end of 2024 .  Amazon's net profit grew 64% year over year in the first quarter to $17 billion . The company is still relentless in finding ways to satisfy customers . Amazon is investing $4 billion through 2026 to expand its rural delivery network in less populated areas of the U.S.  Revenue from Amazon Web Services grew 17% year over year in Q1 and contributed over 60% of the company's operating profit . The stock is down year to date, but investors can expect Amazon to keep growing in value over time and deliver excellent returns .  Warren Buffett's Warren Buffett has a market-crushing outperformance compared to163% for the S&P 500 . Nvidia shares have gotten less expensive, but another big AI player has an even better valuation . The big question is when or even if there will be an adequate return on those investments . Nvidia chips are filling server stacks in many data centers being built globally .  Nvidia's stock has been under pressure as questions surface about demand from a slowdown in AI infrastructure spending . The concerns related to capital spending may be overblown, but export restrictions could be more problematic .  China is an important market for Nvidia . Sales there represented 13% of total revenue last year . That was down from 17% in the previous fiscal year . Recent reports say that President Donald Trump may even be ready to relax AI chip export curbs .  TSMC supplies semiconductor products, including microprocessors, graphics processing units (GPUs) Nvidia is one of several big tech companies reliant on TSMC, but the Taiwan-based company has a diverse customer base . Demand for its services is surging .  Based on customer demand and tech companies' recent comments, the rise in AI development has not become a bubble . Even if capital spending on data center buildouts does slow, that doesn't present the full picture either . Taking that broader view should make most investors comfortable owning both Nvidia and TSMC at recent valuations .  If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, you’d have $614,911! Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, available when you joinStock Advisor, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon .  Microsoft is one of two No-Brainer Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy right now . The Motley Fool has published two AI-related articles on the topic of this week's featured articles .

Wall Street is debating whether, and when, to jump back in to the US stock market . “This is so exhausting,” said Ken Mahoney CEO of Mahoney Asset Management. “There’s no playbook on how to trade this”  Institutional investors who were wary of the market’s head-fakes are dragged back in . Cut-to-the-bone positioning has cleared the path for many of them to return as buyers . Retail investors are chasing everything from Big Tech to industrials .  Fund managers are debating when to reprice the extent to which the Fed may be able to cut rates this year . A decline in realized volatility will cause a rapid normalization in risk premium models . Wall Street had been expecting the central bank to cut next month .  Retail traders are the one group that seems unfazed by the Fed or Trump’s trade policies . At Bank of America, individual-investor clients bought stocks for 21 straight weeks .  Commodity trading advisers, or CTAs, are starting to inch back to the table . CTAs take their cues from the stock market direction rather than fundamental factors . JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Bram Kaplan says CTAs will turn into short-term buyers when the S&P 500 reaches 5,800 .  In March, the S&P 500 broke below its bullish trend line that began when the most recent bull market started in October 2022 . The index is still 7.9% below its Feb. 19 all-time high . To recoup that, the index would need to cross back above 6,000 .  Pre-Tariff car Buying Frenzy leaves Americans with a big debt problem . Maybe AI Slop is Killing the Internet, after all .

Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway portfolio shows what one of the world's top investors likes . Amazon and BYD look poised for long-term success because of their deep economic moats . Buffett plans to retire this year after delivering a return of over 5,000,000% .  Amazon's size creates a positive feedback loop: the vast number of buyers attracts more sellers, which leads to more competition and product variety . The company can unlock economies of scale in its logistics and distribution networks, passing on these savings and efficiencies to consumers . Amazon's cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services (AWS) represents around half of operating income .  In 2024, BYD overtook American rivalTeslato become the top-selling EV brand in the world with revenue of $107 billion . Berkshire Hathaway is one of BYD's highest-profile backers -- first betting on the Chinese EV maker in 2008 .  Tesla's weakness in the EU could turn into an opportunity for BYD to gain market share . With aforward price-to-earnings(P/E) multiple of just 21, BYD's shares are remarkably affordable . Buffett's defensive posture could signal that he feels cautious about the stock market in general . Amazon's P/E ratio is at its lowest point in years . Net sales growth has slowed significantly . The company's performance over the next year may come down to income growth .  Online sales growth slowed to 6% yearly in Q1 when it grew at 7% in the year-ago quarter . Amazon's cloud computing arm, Amazon Web Services (AWS) grew slightly to 17% yearly growth . Also slowing is its third-party seller services business .  Amazon is the No. 1 e-commerce company and cloud provider, and both industries are on track for further growth . Despite slowing net sales growth, its net income in Q1 was $17 billion, a 64% increase from year-ago levels .  Amazon's net sales growth rate was 10.7% one year ago as the company kept its costs and expenses in check . Amazon's two main industries are likely to continue growing rapidly for the rest of the decade . Even if its profits do not match that growth rate in the first quarter of 2026 . Amazon stock will be in a similar direction in 2015 . Amazon is now in the hands of more than 50 million people .

Amazon launched its first complete payload of Kuiper internet satellites on April 28 . Amazon says it will begin satellite internet service for customers this year . I'm skeptical .  It took SpaceX 15 months to move from initial testing of its own experimental Starlink satellites to kicking off full-scale production . Amazon finally launched its first batch of operational Kuipersats aboard another ULA Atlas V. Last week's launch was roughly a year behind schedule .  SpaceX has more than 7,100 Starlinks in orbit, generating billions in annual revenue . Most Starlinks going up are V2 Mini models, significantly upgraded from the original Starlink . Amazon is now in a race against time to get 50% of its constellation (1,618 satellites) completed by a Federal Communications Commission (FCC) deadline that tolls on July 30, 2026 .  Amazon's Kuipersats orbit higher than SpaceX's Starlinks . Each Kuipersat can cover more square footage down on Earth than can an equivalent Starlink . Amazon has to buy up all the rocket rides all around the world for the next year or three to get its constellation completed .  Amazon says it plans to begin beta service later this year, but it's building fewer than 1,618 satellites . The company says it wants to launch five Kuipersats a day, but the Wall Street Journal says it's currently building only one a day . Amazon is hoping to get at least beta service up and running by July 30, 2026, hoping this will be enough to convince FCC to extend license .  Amazon.com.com is one of the fastest growing companies in the world . The company has been in the news for more than a decade . Amazon is the world's biggest tech giant, but it's not easy to predict .  Amazon launches 27 Satellites in First Challenge to SpaceX and Starlink . The company is one of the three companies Amazon has invested in . Amazon will not be giving it another chance like this anytime soon .

Walmart WMT shares have been standout performers this year, outperforming the broader market indexes and peers like Target TGT . The company is set to report quarterly results on Thursday, May 15th . It will be interesting to see if the stock can maintain its performance momentum after the results .  Management touched on some of these trends in its April 9th investor day event, noting some near-term tariff-related challenges . Walmart has been coming ahead of its target over the last two years, with sales up +5.5% and operating income up +9.5%.  Walmart’s value orientation and well-executed digital strategy have been key to gaining grocery market share by attracting higher-income households . Management indicated their commitment to maintain price advantage over rivals . Walmart is expected to report $0.58 in EPS on $165.6 billion in revenues, representing year-over-year changes .  Same-store sales (ex-fuel) are expected to be up +3.21% for the quarter, compared to +4.9% in the preceding period . Target's Q1 earnings season scorecard now has results from 20 of the 33 retailers in the S&P 500 index .  The Zacks Retail sector includes Walmart, Target, and other traditional retailers, online vendors like Amazon AMZN, and restaurant players . Total Q1 earnings for these 20 retailers that have reported are up +20.2% from the same period last year on +6.9% higher revenues .  Amazon is now a decent-sized brick-and-mortar operator after Whole Foods and Walmart is a growing online vendor . The two comparison charts below show the Q1 earnings and revenue growth relative to other recent periods with Amazon’s results .  Through Friday, we have seen Q1 results from 452 S&P 500 members . Total earnings for these 452 index members are up +12.2% from the same period last year on +4.4% revenue gains . 73.7% of the companies beating EPS estimates and 61.9% beating revenue estimates .  Q1 EPS beats percentage of 73.7% for the companies that have reported already comparing to the average for the same group of 78% over the preceding 20-quarter period (5 years) Q1 as a whole, combining the actuals from the 452 S&P 500 members with estimates for the still-to-come companies, the expectation is that earnings will be up +12.3% from the same period last year on +4.5% higher revenues . The chart below shows current earnings and revenue growth expectations for 2025 Q1 in the context of where growth has been .  We noted in recent weeks that estimates for the current period (2025 Q2) have been coming down . The magnitude of cuts to 2025 Q2 estimates since the start of the period is bigger and more widespread relative to what we have become used to seeing in the post-COVID period . But we are starting to notice a curious development with the Tech sector estimate, both for Q2 as well as full-year 2025 .  Tech sector’s evolving earnings expectations for full-year 2025 have also increased in annual estimates as well . If trend continues for a few more weeks, it will be hard to interpret this development as a sign that the earnings picture has clearly stabilized and started to strengthen .  Tech sector estimates have come under pressure in recent weeks, with the negative revisions trend becoming very meaningful and widespread since mid-February 2025 . But upward revisions to tech sector estimates is starting to show up in full-year estimates, causing a reversal in the negative revision trend .  Zacksacksacks.
